intro: Mariscus oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxaca mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is a perennial shrub that can reach a height of up to 1 meter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
